Crimes.Dispute_Type: Dispute over water encroachment on First Nations' lands due to structures built by PFRA
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Can the RCMP's decision not to lay trespass charges be subject to judicial review?
Crimes.Governing_Law: Judicial review principles regarding prosecutorial discretion
Crimes.Decision_Level: RCMP decision not to lay charges
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review application challenging RCMP's refusal to lay charges
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: No evidence supported claim of treaty obligation or Aboriginal right to preferential policing
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Principles of judicial review of prosecutorial discretion
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Alleged infringement of Aboriginal and treaty rights
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: RCMP consulted legal counsel and acted within discretionary authority
Crimes.Regulation_Cited: Common law principles on prosecutorial discretion
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Judicial review only available in cases of flagrant impropriety
Crimes.Application_Factor: Nature of Aboriginal and treaty rights claims
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Scope of judicial review over police discretion
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of evidence supporting treaty obligations or preferential policing rights
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient evidence to support claims of Aboriginal rights violation
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: RCMP conducted review and consulted legal counsel
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Applicants' claims not substantiated by evidence
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claim that RCMP breached fiduciary duties
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Focus: Federal jurisdiction involving RCMP and First Nations lands
Crimes.Relevant_Law: Aboriginal and treaty rights under Canadian Constitution
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Standing and justiciability of police charging decisions

Crimes.Violation_Type: Alleged unauthorized presence/encroachment on reserve land
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Can the RCMP's decision not to lay trespass charges against PFRA and SWA be subject to judicial review, and if so, under what standard?
Crimes.Governing_Law: Doctrine of police and prosecutorial discretion
Crimes.Application_Facts: Water control structures built by PFRA and SWA caused flooding on reserve lands
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review ordering RCMP to lay trespass charges
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Application dismissed; no jurisdiction to compel police action
Crimes.Claimant_Status: First Nations communities affected by encroachment
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: PFRA and SWA constructed water management infrastructure leading to flooding
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Trespass on reserve lands due to water encroachment
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Judicial review only permissible in cases of flagrant impropriety
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Thoroughness of RCMP investigation and consultation with legal counsel
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: Criminal Code (implied), common law on discretion
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Limits of judicial intervention in police investigative decisions
Crimes.Review_Standard: High threshold: conduct must shock the conscience
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Claims lacked evidentiary support regarding Aboriginal rights violations
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Doctrinal limits on judicial review of prosecutorial discretion
Crimes.Application_Basis: Request for enforcement of property rights on reserve land
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: No proof of treaty-based obligation or Aboriginal right to exclusive control
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Compel RCMP to initiate criminal proceedings
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Police discretion is largely non-reviewable absent abuse
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to prove existence of enforceable Aboriginal or treaty right
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Flooding and land encroachment impacting reserve lands
Crimes.Cause_Description: Dispute over water encroachment from federal/provincial agency structures
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: RCMP reviewed all submitted materials and sought legal advice
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Potential trespass under provincial/federal law (not pursued)
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: No direct evidence of criminal intent or unlawful occupation
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Common law standards for police discretion
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Interplay between federal agencies and Indigenous land rights
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: RCMP found insufficient basis for criminal charges
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No flagrant impropriety in RCMP’s decision-making process
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of admissible evidence linking actions to criminal trespass
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Threshold for judicial review of police discretion

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Damage or interference with property via water diversion structures
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Can the RCMP's decision not to lay trespass or mischief charges be subject to judicial review, and if so, under what standard?
Crimes.Governing_Law: Criminal Code provisions on mischief and police discretion
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: RCMP evaluated evidence and determined no criminal threshold met
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: No charges laid for mischief or trespass
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicants to show improper exercise of discretion
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Claims of RCMP bias due to conflicted legal counsel rejected
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Police discretion protected unless flagrant impropriety shown
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Extremely limited—only where decision shocks the conscience
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged damage to reserve lands through water control projects
Crimes.Review_Standard: Flagrant impropriety or bad faith required
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: RCMP followed proper procedures and provided reasoning
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Criminal Code and constitutional Aboriginal rights framework
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: RCMP failed to consider Aboriginal rights and used biased counsel
Crimes.Legal_Rule_Source: Common law and jurisprudence on prosecutorial independence
Crimes.Standard_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities (civil standard in review context)
Crimes.Defendant_Response: RCMP asserted lawful exercise of investigative discretion
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section of Criminal Code related to mischief (implied s. 430)
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Criminal Code, s. 430 (mischief); common law on discretion
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Failure to meet threshold for judicial intervention
Crimes.Jurisdiction: Federal court jurisdiction over Crown agency decisions
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Non-justiciability of operational police decisions absent abuse
